instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No SLP Board #2
threads.message:
I have two identical boards with identical issues and had this thread going: [url]https://www.rossmanngroup.com/boards/forum/board-repair-troubleshooting/2894-<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-no-slp[/url]

They had the exact same symptoms until the last piece of info that Duke was asking for. I'm not sure of the best way to go about this but rather than hijack my own thread or do all of that over again I'm going to just pick it up from that same spot and post the measurements for the new one.
The issue is no <SIGNAL>SLP_S4</SIGNAL> lines. Liquid-damage.
His last entry was: "My suspect of SPI ROM data line is still the best guess. Remove ROM and measure all pins on diode mode." Here is the response for this new board:

1. .590
2. .495
3. .506
4. 0
5. .519
6. .519
7. .511
8 .406

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No SLP Board #2
threads.message: The question is, is it pulsing all S0 power rails?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No SLP Board #2
threads.message: It's doing everything exactly the same as the other board. All measurements are the same until we get to these for the removed SPI ROM chip. I went through every step from the other thread. Are there other S0 rails you think I should check?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No SLP Board #2
threads.message: Nothing really wrong with those values. Have you checked J6100 for corrosion? Usually I just take it off.
